Spirit of
Halloweentown

The historic town of St. Helens, 45 minutes from Portland, Oregon celebrates Halloween all October long

We're Lighting the Great Pumpkin in:

Free Every Day

Tour maps are available on the message board at Courthouse Plaza

Festive Photo Ops at the courthouse Plaza

The Courthouse Plaza is open every day of the week.

Get Inspired
Explore St. Helensâ€™ Century Old Town District

Have a look, wander around. There are charming shops, restaurants, and breweries near the riverfront, which is the Old Town portion of St. Helens.

Resources
Pack a Picnic and Grab a Sketchbook

Capture views of the Columbia River, Mount St. Helens, and Mount Hood.

Our Favorite Picnic Locations

Special guests from the Halloweentown Movies

Tickets for Photos and Autographs are Available Now

Emily Roeske

Emily Roeske, also known as Sophie Piper, was seven years old when she appeared in the Disney Channel Original Movie. She continued to be a part of the franchise through the second and third films and had a guest role on ER.

Get Tickets

Joey Zimmerman

Joey Zimmerman is a famous actor who played the role of Dylan Piper in the Halloweentown movies. He has also acted in successful TV shows such as That '70s Show and 7th Heaven. Currently, he is a skilled photographer and has co-founded ZFO Entertainment.

Get Tickets

Phillip Van Dyke

Phillip Van Dyke, also known as Luke, is best known for his roles as the goblin Luke in the first two Halloweentown films and Arnold in seasons two and three of Hey Arnold! on Nickelodeon.

Get Tickets

It's not technically Halloween until you've played Monster Mash.

What Our Visitors are Saying About Us

Reviews collected from Google Maps

Spirit of Halloweentown was a wonderful experience! Located near the Columbia River, this event offered great views, and plenty of entertainment. Its a must see for anyone whether your into Halloween or not. Thank you for continuing to keep this annual tradition going!

Tony Vidrio

Local Guide,
Google Reviewer

So much to do and so much fun!! We stayed for 4.5 hours and had endless amounts of fun going. Worth the money. A bonus is the shuttle driver was telling us the profits from the tickets go to charities for kids.

Breanne Diles

Local Guide,
Google Reviewer

Kitschy, quaint fall festival located where Halloweentown and parts of Twilight were filmed. The local shops and historic downtown right on the water make for a great walk. Vendors are typically more available on weekends but weekdays mean fewer crowds. The town has a very Stars Hollow-esque feel to it.

Profoundcake

Local Guide,
Google Reviewer

This event was so much fun! My kids had a blast doing all the activities and taking pictures. We loved the costume contest, the Haunted House, the boat ride to walk with pumpkins, etc. The Queen, Mayor, and Jack were wonderful and the vendors were great. The extra shows were great (pirates, strong woman, witches dance, etc).

Koa-Marie Turner

Local Guide,
Google Reviewer

The Spirit of Halloweentown has been featured on ABC News, MTV, Vogue, Entertainment Weekly, BuzzFeed, Country Living, Huffington Post and many other recognized news outlets.PRESS Â»

Free Events Every Weekend

Free

The Vendors Village

Across from the Main Plaza Square you'll find vendors and live performances in the park.

Free

Costume Contest

Each weekend day at 1:30pm we hold a costume contest and anyone can participate in categories of Adult, Family or Child. Cash prizes in each category.

Free

Pirates at the Riverfront

Cannon Fire shows at 1pm and 4 pm. Bonfires and seating are available Captain Jack Sparrow and others are present for photo ops

Free

Meet a Real Life Mermaid

Appearance by Una the Mermaid at the Main Plaza Square. Every weekend in October 2pm - 2pm & 3 - 5pm
